title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
The Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa is an AA 5 star, award-winning resort based in St Andrews which prides itself on the highest levels of guest care.
We are an independently owned resort, forming part of Kohler Company, a leading global hospitality provider. To find out more about Kohler Co. please visit www.kohler.com

Why Join Our Team?

With a reputation as an employer of choice, we are committed to ensuring our associates are our number one priority. St Andrews is the home of golf and we are the home of great guest service. People are our passion and we believe each associate plays a vital role in providing memorable memories to our guests.
We are a forward-thinking employer committed to the Hoteliers Charter and developing our people, which is why we employ based on personality. We believe all skills can be taught! Throughout your career with us, you’ll have access to a wide range of different training opportunities providing routes to progress from within, allowing you to reach your full potential whilst supported by our committed leadership team.
We love celebrating our associate’s success and do so through our employee reward recognition schemes which encompass our ‘HOME’ ethos including Associate of the Month.
Whilst working for one of the most iconic hotels in Scotland, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, company pension scheme, free onsite car parking, meals whilst on duty, 24/7 acccess to our employee assistance line and FREE fitness access.
Our benefits don’t end there, in your spare time, we also offer free access to The Duke’s golf course and superb discounts in our restaurants and spa. Giving you the opportunity to enjoy the many luxuries Old Course Hotel has to offer and experience the 5* service for yourself.
When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.
Salary
This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

description:

When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.

This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

2. Service Coordination: Efficiently coordinate the maintenance and any call outs of fire and security systems, ensuring that client expectations are met or exceeded.

3. Installation Coordination: Efficiently coordinate the installation of fire and security systems for your assigned contracts, ensuring that client expectations are met or exceeded.

4.Problem Resolution: Address client concerns promptly and effectively, working closely with technical teams to ensure timely resolution of issues.

5. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions, service requests, and system specifications using our CRM system.

6. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with sales, technical support, and field service teams to deliver a unified and seamless experience for our clients.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
The Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa is an AA 5 star, award-winning resort based in St Andrews which prides itself on the highest levels of guest care.
We are an independently owned resort, forming part of Kohler Company, a leading global hospitality provider. To find out more about Kohler Co. please visit www.kohler.com

Why Join Our Team?

With a reputation as an employer of choice, we are committed to ensuring our associates are our number one priority. St Andrews is the home of golf and we are the home of great guest service. People are our passion and we believe each associate plays a vital role in providing memorable memories to our guests.
We are a forward-thinking employer committed to the Hoteliers Charter and developing our people, which is why we employ based on personality. We believe all skills can be taught! Throughout your career with us, you’ll have access to a wide range of different training opportunities providing routes to progress from within, allowing you to reach your full potential whilst supported by our committed leadership team.
We love celebrating our associate’s success and do so through our employee reward recognition schemes which encompass our ‘HOME’ ethos including Associate of the Month.
Whilst working for one of the most iconic hotels in Scotland, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, company pension scheme, free onsite car parking, meals whilst on duty, 24/7 acccess to our employee assistance line and FREE fitness access.
Our benefits don’t end there, in your spare time, we also offer free access to The Duke’s golf course and superb discounts in our restaurants and spa. Giving you the opportunity to enjoy the many luxuries Old Course Hotel has to offer and experience the 5* service for yourself.
When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.
Salary
This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
The Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa is an AA 5 star, award-winning resort based in St Andrews which prides itself on the highest levels of guest care.
We are an independently owned resort, forming part of Kohler Company, a leading global hospitality provider. To find out more about Kohler Co. please visit www.kohler.com

Why Join Our Team?

With a reputation as an employer of choice, we are committed to ensuring our associates are our number one priority. St Andrews is the home of golf and we are the home of great guest service. People are our passion and we believe each associate plays a vital role in providing memorable memories to our guests.
We are a forward-thinking employer committed to the Hoteliers Charter and developing our people, which is why we employ based on personality. We believe all skills can be taught! Throughout your career with us, you’ll have access to a wide range of different training opportunities providing routes to progress from within, allowing you to reach your full potential whilst supported by our committed leadership team.
We love celebrating our associate’s success and do so through our employee reward recognition schemes which encompass our ‘HOME’ ethos including Associate of the Month.
Whilst working for one of the most iconic hotels in Scotland, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, company pension scheme, free onsite car parking, meals whilst on duty, 24/7 acccess to our employee assistance line and FREE fitness access.
Our benefits don’t end there, in your spare time, we also offer free access to The Duke’s golf course and superb discounts in our restaurants and spa. Giving you the opportunity to enjoy the many luxuries Old Course Hotel has to offer and experience the 5* service for yourself.
When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.
Salary
This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

description:
The Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa is an AA 5 star, award-winning resort based in St Andrews which prides itself on the highest levels of guest care.
We are an independently owned resort, forming part of Kohler Company, a leading global hospitality provider. To find out more about Kohler Co. please visit www.kohler.com

Why Join Our Team?

With a reputation as an employer of choice, we are committed to ensuring our associates are our number one priority. St Andrews is the home of golf and we are the home of great guest service. People are our passion and we believe each associate plays a vital role in providing memorable memories to our guests.
We are a forward-thinking employer committed to the Hoteliers Charter and developing our people, which is why we employ based on personality. We believe all skills can be taught! Throughout your career with us, you’ll have access to a wide range of different training opportunities providing routes to progress from within, allowing you to reach your full potential whilst supported by our committed leadership team.
We love celebrating our associate’s success and do so through our employee reward recognition schemes which encompass our ‘HOME’ ethos including Associate of the Month.
Whilst working for one of the most iconic hotels in Scotland, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, company pension scheme, free onsite car parking, meals whilst on duty, 24/7 acccess to our employee assistance line and FREE fitness access.
Our benefits don’t end there, in your spare time, we also offer free access to The Duke’s golf course and superb discounts in our restaurants and spa. Giving you the opportunity to enjoy the many luxuries Old Course Hotel has to offer and experience the 5* service for yourself.
When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.
Salary
This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

BRE is inviting applications from suitably qualified individuals for the role of Service Administrator.

Reporting directly to the Office Manager, the Service Administrator is the key customer contact at BRE Limited.

They will provide support to the office manager, provide assistance to clients and carry out office general administrative activities.

The Service Administrator will also manage and mentor the Office / Service Assistant.

BRE Ltd has been trading for over 35 years and is the longest serving Premier Distributor in Scotland for Atlas Copco Industrial Air Products.

Role Requirements:

  • Handle product and service enquiries from clients
  • Monitor and mentor Office / Service Assistant to ensure they understand work activities processes to ensure maximum productivity
  • Create and process quotations and orders
  • Update and monitor system tracking of orders on the ClickService System
  • Liaise and communicate with suppliers to arrange order or goods and services for clients and in-house use
  • Ensure supplier price listings and product manuals are kept up to date
  • Provide feedback on supplier performance to the Office Manager
  • Assist with client complaints and supplier issues
  • Assist in Corrective Action Reporting (CARs) investigations
  • Comply with BRE Limited QHSE management system requirements at all times
  • Participate in BRE Limited QHSE awareness events and contribute to the improvement of the QHSE Management System
  • Assist in ensuring the protection of the environment by recycling, reusing and minimising waste and energy use wherever possible

Qualifications and Skills

  • Good working knowledge of MS Office
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Good knowledge of products and services provided by BRE Limited
  • Able to work alone or as part of a team
  • Strong organisational skills with the ability to multi-task
  • Knowledge of office management systems and procedures
  • BRE-245 – Environmental Awareness Presentation

What we can offer you:

  • An opportunity for the right candidate to advance their career in the industry.
  • Manufacturer based training provided.

Job Type:

Full-time, Permanent

To Apply:

Send your CV and covering letter by email to in**@br***.com

title: Systems Administrator
description:
Kettle Produce Limited is one of the main providers of fresh and pre-packed vegetables in the country. We are a dynamic and customer focused business and these are exactly the kind of qualities we look for in all our employees.

We currently have an opportunity for a System Administrator to join our Engineering team.

As a System Administrator your role will be to maintain the Preventative Planned Maintenance (PPM) system.

Key tasks and responsibilities:

~ Develop and maintain an effective operational understanding of the Computerised Maintenance Management System (CMMS)

~ Maintain the Preventative Planned Maintenance (PPM) scheduler

~ Monitor completion of work orders and raise issues with line management

~ Ensure daily and weekly planned maintenance tasks are highlighted to the engineering management in a timely manner

~ Develop and issue plans for equipment overhaul and replacement

~ Liaise with relevant stakeholders to ensure parts, resources and equipment is planned and available for all scheduled works to be carried out

~ Prepare necessary progress reports

~ Attend any relevant meetings as required

~ Liaise with external services (contractors/ agencies)

Our ideal candidate will have;

~ experience in administration and planning/ scheduling

~ experience with Microsoft packages and computer systems

~ excellent organisational skills

~ the ability to work autonomously and use initiative

~ excellent attention to detail

~ good communication and interpersonal skills – a good understanding of verbal and written English

The role will provide successful candidates with an excellent career opportunity in a fast paced and challenging environment. This role is a temporary role, with scope to become permanent, if successful.

  • planning: 1 year (required)

title: Receptionist/administrative Assistant
description:
Guthrie Castle Limited is recruiting a Receptionist/Administrator to join our team. We run a small estate office providing in-house business seminars, several times a year. We seek a reliable and organised person to join our small office team, who idealy would have hospitality experience.

This is a full-time position, and we are looking for someone who is adaptable, flexible and is able to multi-task.

Responsibilities include:

  • Excellent phone manner, answer phone calls and direct them to the appropriate staff members
  • Working in the Estate Office, greet and assist visitors in a professional and friendly manner and maintain visitor records.
  • Perform general clerical duties, including but not limited to photocopying, scanning, data entry tasks and filing.
  • Occasional front-of-house roles as required.
  • Undertake and comply with all company security and emergency procedures.
  • Ability to work on your own and as part of a small team.
  • Manage incoming and outgoing mail and packages
  • Dog lover
  • Generally, Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm. Occasional overtime during seminars

Skills:

  • Previous experience in an administrative or receptionist role is preferred
  • Previous hospitality experience
  • Proficient IT skills, including using computerised systems
  • Good communication skills, both written and verbal
  • You must have a full, clean driver's licence; and your own reliable transport is essential.
  • The office has dogs, so you need to like dogs.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is organized, detail-oriented, and enjoys working in an estate office environment. If you meet the requirements above, we would love to hear from you.

Please note that only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Thank you for your interest in joining our team!

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Business Systems Trainer

Full Time

Welcome to a very different kind of law firm. One that recognises its success is down to its people. Where you can be yourself. Be inspired by your talented work colleagues. Where you’ll feel part of a dynamic team. Where, right from the start, you will be trusted with responsibility. This is what a rewarding career looks like at Thorntons.

What to expect

We are looking for an experienced legal secretary to join our Private Client team in Dundee. You’ll be involved in a diverse range of tasks to ensure the smooth functioning of our legal operations including:

  • Dealing with Client Enquiries: act as a point of contact for client enquiries and effectively coordinate meetings.
  • Audio and Copy Typing: Accurate and timely transcription services for legal documentation as well as attendance notes, emails and other documentation
  • Case Management: Use our case management system to update and manage legal documents and information efficiently; opening/closing client files in a timely manner.
  • General Administration: Assist in the preparation of various forms, such as LBTT, Registers of Scotland, searches, etc., using the appropriate online portals.
  • Office Tasks: Undertake general office tasks, including filing, photocopying, scanning, and invoicing.

What we’re looking for

We’re looking for someone with the following skills, experience and qualities:

  • Previous legal secretarial or other relevant experience in a legal administration role.
  • Excellent people skills - confident and able to work as part of a bigger team across multiple locations and remotely
  • Strong general administrative skills
  • Excellent communication and client service skills
  • Excellent telephone manner
  • Calm under pressure, good organisational skills and excellent time management - with the ability to prioritise and deliver to deadlines
  • An excellent knowledge of all Microsoft platforms including Word, Outlook, etc.
  • A working knowledge of using online digital dictation would be beneficial
  • Commitment to providing the very best service to clients

Hours

  • Monday – Friday, 9am – 5pm (35 hours per week)

Doing What’s Right

A great working environment is the first thing you’ll notice. One where you’ll be inspired and supported by your colleagues. Where we’ll help you achieve what you want from your career. Where you can have both flexibility and connection with our supportive culture. Where you are valued. Where your voice is heard and you can make a difference through our employee network groups.

As your employer

Our benefits package goes well beyond competitive remuneration and we recognise and reward your hard work - learn more at rewarding you

For your Health and Wellbeing

Our Healthcare Cash Plan covers things like dental, optical, physiotherapy, chiropody, therapy and health screening needs. Our mental health first aiders and access to a 24-hour counselling line provide support for your mental and emotional wellbeing.

Embracing Diversity and Inclusion

We strongly believe in a diverse and inclusive working environment: one that does not tolerate any form of discrimination at any level. We value a truly diverse workforce: we are all equally different. We celebrate our individuality: from gender, sexual orientation, ethnicity, faith to life experience, we know our differences make us stronger, together.

For our Community

We’re proud to be part of the communities we serve across Scotland, that’s why we actively engage with charities that support them. From our annual Charity Wills campaign to regular fundraising and volunteering opportunities, our colleagues give back to communities with skills and advocacy as well as funds.

Application closing date: 18th February 2024

Apply online or send a CV through to opportunities@thorntons-law.co.uk referencing the Job Title, Location & Hours

title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
IC Fire & Security Limited are a Dundee based company that have been established for 16 years, providing life safety and security systems and services to our client base throughout Scotland. Here at IC Fire & Security, we pride ourselves on our reputation in which we aim to provide our customers with the best possible experience from point of enquiry right through to completion. Due to key contract wins and organic growth, our Sales Department have created a new role within it of Service Desk Administrator.

Position Overview:

As a Service Desk Administrator, you will play a crucial role within our Administrative team, collaborating closely with another Service Desk Administrator. In this dynamic role, your responsibilities will centre around providing dedicated administrative support for contracts, facilitating seamless coordination between clients and engineers in the installation and ongoing maintenance of fire and security systems. Additionally, you will provide coverage for the contracts managed by your counterpart during holidays and other periods of absence, with the guidance and support of the Administration Manager.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Client Communication: Act as the primary liaison between clients and our company, providing timely and clear communication regarding services, installations, and ongoing support.

2. Service Coordination: Efficiently coordinate the maintenance and any call outs of fire and security systems, ensuring that client expectations are met or exceeded.

3. Installation Coordination: Efficiently coordinate the installation of fire and security systems for your assigned contracts, ensuring that client expectations are met or exceeded.

4.Problem Resolution: Address client concerns promptly and effectively, working closely with technical teams to ensure timely resolution of issues.

5. Documentation: Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of client interactions, service requests, and system specifications using our CRM system.

6. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with sales, technical support, and field service teams to deliver a unified and seamless experience for our clients.

Work Remotely

  • No

Equal Opportunities Statement

IC Fire & Security are an equal opportunities employer, and we welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their sex; religious or similar philosophical belief; political opinion; race; age; sexual orientation; or, whether they are married or are in a civil partnership; or, whether they are disabled; or whether they have undergone, are undergoing or intend to undergo gender reassignment.

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Life Assurance Scheme
  • Paid Sick Pay
  • Wellness programme
  • Learning & Development opportunities (including support from the business to further your education)
  • Potential progression route within a growing business function
  • 28 days holiday (with increase after 5 years of service)

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: £23,000.00-£28,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • On-site parking
  • Work from home

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • GCSE or equivalent (required)

Experience:

  • Administrative: 2 years (required)

Ability to Commute:

  • Dundee (required)

Work Location: In person

Application deadline: 16/02/2024

title: Operations Administrator
description:
Due to an expansion of the business, we are looking to find the ideal candidate to fill the role of Operations Assistant, based at our office in Auchtermuchty, Fife.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the General Manager, this role involves working in the engineering office, supporting the managers with administration involved in the day-to-day operations of the business. Duties would include:

  • Inputting jobs and updating the engineering system with job details and other relevant drawings and files.
  • Answering telephone calls, dealing with any queries and providing updates on job progress and shipping. The applicant should have the ability to assess when it is necessary to pass on messages or whether to deal directly.
  • Management of generic email inboxes and calendars. This will involve initial assessment of emails and either directly dealing or forwarding to the most appropriate department.
  • Processing time sheets, ensuring quality and accuracy.
  • Answering the intercom to visitors and clients, booking in and dealing efficiently and politely with all callers, deliveries and drivers.
  • Proactively making phone calls/sending emails to provide updates on job progress.
  • Assisting with paperwork relating to deliveries and collections - such as processing delivery notes and notifying the relevant staff.
  • Support bookings and arrangements for clients visiting site. Arranging meeting rooms and hospitality.
  • Working closely with the estimators and drawing office to ensure that all updates from these departments are updated quickly and accurately.
  • Assisting the General Manager/Directors with any other duty relating to the effective operations of the business.

Experience in a similar role would be an advantage but is not a strict requirment. We are looking for is someone who is:

  • Able to use the full suite of Microsoft Office apps, cloud apps/databases and telephone systems.
  • A proactive, motivated approach to work and the ability to work on your own initiative.
  • The ability to solve problems and work with an innovative spirit - being flexible and dynamic rather than rigid. You must be a confident decision maker.
  • A clear and easy going communicator who is approachable and confident to ask questions.
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritise tasks effectively

Full induction/training will be provided.

Starting pay is dependent on skills and experience. Uniform will be provided.

Immediate start is available.

NO AGENCIES

title: Business Administrator
description:
Business Administrator – Earth Energy Education

Are you a diligent enthusiastic person with high attention to detail who wants to join a small mission led organisation?

We are a team of educators looking for core office support to keep our business running and to enable us to grow it to the next level.

Based in rural Perthshire we work across the UK. We provide educational services to renewable energy sites and are looking to expand our work across Scotland. We play an important role in educating the children of the future on green energy, climate change and biodiversity.

We have eight part time team members and one full time member. Our clients include community energy groups and multinational corporations.

In this role you will report to and support the Operations Manager and you will expect a broad range of challenges and learning opportunities in your role. You must like variety, short term deadlines and be able to challenge or suggest how we can improve.

You will provide high-level administrative support that includes working directly with the Director and the team members - coordinating the business’s activities.

To be considered for this role, you should possess experience of working as an executive level administrator or equivalent. You should possess the following attributes:

  • You should be comfortable with variety, having superior communication, time management and coordination skills
  • You should be able to use your initiative in the conduct of your work - adopting a proactive approach and applying your own judgement

You should be quick to pick up new concepts and ideas

Main Duties

  • Keeping well-organised files and records of visits, workshops, contracts and delivery commitments
  • Keeping computer databases up to date
  • Developing and initiating relationships with schools

  • Collecting and inputting company data

title: Front Desk Receptionist
description:
The Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa is an AA 5 star, award-winning resort based in St Andrews which prides itself on the highest levels of guest care.
We are an independently owned resort, forming part of Kohler Company, a leading global hospitality provider. To find out more about Kohler Co. please visit www.kohler.com

Why Join Our Team?

With a reputation as an employer of choice, we are committed to ensuring our associates are our number one priority. St Andrews is the home of golf and we are the home of great guest service. People are our passion and we believe each associate plays a vital role in providing memorable memories to our guests.
We are a forward-thinking employer committed to the Hoteliers Charter and developing our people, which is why we employ based on personality. We believe all skills can be taught! Throughout your career with us, you’ll have access to a wide range of different training opportunities providing routes to progress from within, allowing you to reach your full potential whilst supported by our committed leadership team.
We love celebrating our associate’s success and do so through our employee reward recognition schemes which encompass our ‘HOME’ ethos including Associate of the Month.
Whilst working for one of the most iconic hotels in Scotland, you will be rewarded with a competitive salary, company pension scheme, free onsite car parking, meals whilst on duty, 24/7 acccess to our employee assistance line and FREE fitness access.
Our benefits don’t end there, in your spare time, we also offer free access to The Duke’s golf course and superb discounts in our restaurants and spa. Giving you the opportunity to enjoy the many luxuries Old Course Hotel has to offer and experience the 5* service for yourself.
When you are not on duty at the Old Course Hotel, Golf Resort & Spa, you have access to request to stay overnight at a discounted rate, where available.
A career at Old Course Hotel, what’s not to love?
  • All benefits subject to availability

About the Role

Our Front of House Team are the stars of our resort who warmly welcome our guests and are their point of contact throughout their stay with us. By having a complete understanding of the department and of the hotel’s various facilities and objectives the Receptionist will offer the very highest possible service, ensuring all guests have a memorable and magical stay.


Duties and Responsibilities

· To welcome guest with a cheerful and proper greeting
· To check the guest into the hotel in a friendly and courteous manner
· Upsell to best satisfy guest’s needs and maximise hotel room revenue
· To ensure that all guests are escorted to their rooms
· To advise guests of the hotel information and opening times of the outlets
· To explain the in-room facilities and point out the nearest fire exits
· Greeting guests in a friendly and professional manner during check-outs, asking if their stay was satisfactory
· To provide copy of their bill for review and explain guest room charges
· To deal with any questions that might arise or ask the senior staff member on duty or FoH Manager for assistance
· To process express check outs when necessary
· To count the safe and reception floats at the beginning of the shift, ensuring there is a varied assortment of change and notes
· To be responsible for the overall balance of the floats when on duty and to rectify any discrepancies
· To ensure that the banking is done at the end of the shift based on the audit totals
· To accurately post guest charges and payments
· To ensure that all other departments takings are received, recorded and deposited in the drop safe
· To have good knowledge of and assist switchboard with invoices.

About You

You will be a polite, friendly and confident individual who prides themselves on providing excellent customer service. You’ll also be an efficient administrator with a welcoming telephone manner and ideally, have recent working experience within Front of House in a hotel. Having the willingness to go the extra mile and remaining calm and reliable under pressure are essential for this role.
Salary
This is a permanent full-time opportunity, working 40 hours per week over a flexible shift pattern, between the hours of 7.30 a.m. and 8 p.m. An element of weekend working is also required for this role. Along with a competitive salary of £24,523.20, we offer a vast range of associate benefits.

Job Types: Permanent, Full-time
Salary: £24,523.20 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekend availability
Work Location: In person

On November 6, Kohler Co. announced the strategic decision to establish Kohler Energy as a separate, independent business with Platinum Equity as the majority investment partner. Kohler will continue to stay invested in the Energy business following the closing and remains committed to supporting the acceleration of long-term growth strategies for both organizations. Talent and operational transition plans are underway, and Kohler Co. and Platinum Equity expect the agreement to close in the first half of 2024.Thank you for your interest in joining our growing team as we embark on the next phase of growth!
